intro: Hieracium dentatum subsp. dentissimum, commonly known as the toothed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of serrated, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by petal-like rays, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
